materials.raw_text: Co: 16 g, Nd: 4 g, P: 12 g, Ru: 2 g, Sm: 2 g

sourcing.instructions: Co (Cobalt) - Metal supplier or online metal vendors; Nd (Neodymium) - Rare earth material suppliers; P (Phosphorus) - Chemical supply companies; Ru (Ruthenium) - Precious metal suppliers; Sm (Samarium) - Rare earth material suppliers.
steps: Co (Cobalt) - Metal supplier or online metal vendors; Nd (Neodymium) - Rare earth material suppliers; P (Phosphorus) - Chemical supply companies; Ru (Ruthenium) - Precious metal suppliers; Sm (Samarium) - Rare earth material suppliers.

1. Weigh out 16 g of cobalt powder. 2. Weigh out 4 g of neodymium powder. 3. Weigh out 12 g of phosphorus powder. 4. Weigh out 2 g of ruthenium powder. 5. Weigh out 2 g of samarium powder. 6. Combine all powder ingredients in a clean, dry ceramic or glass container. 7. Mix the powders thoroughly using a mortar and pestle or a mechanical mixer until a uniform blend is achieved.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh out 16 g of cobalt powder. 2. Weigh out 4 g of neodymium powder. 3. Weigh out 12 g of phosphorus powder. 4. Weigh out 2 g of ruthenium powder. 5. Weigh out 2 g of samarium powder. 6. Combine all powder ingredients in a clean, dry ceramic or glass container. 7. Mix the powders thoroughly using a mortar and pestle or a mechanical mixer until a uniform blend is achieved.

steps: 1. Transfer the mixed powders into a suitable crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a high-temperature furnace. 3. Heat to 1200째C (2192째F) for 2 hours to achieve proper alloying. 4. Ensure an inert atmosphere (e.g., argon) is maintained during the heating process to prevent oxidation.
heating.raw_text: 1. Transfer the mixed powders into a suitable crucible. 2. Place the crucible in a high-temperature furnace. 3. Heat to 1200째C (2192째F) for 2 hours to achieve proper alloying. 4. Ensure an inert atmosphere (e.g., argon) is maintained during the heating process to prevent oxidation.

steps: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool slowly to room temperature (approximately 1 hour) before opening to prevent thermal shock. 2. Once cooled, remove the crucible from the furnace.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After 2 hours, turn off the furnace and allow it to cool slowly to room temperature (approximately 1 hour) before opening to prevent thermal shock. 2. Once cooled, remove the crucible from the furnace.

steps: 1. Remove the alloyed material from the crucible. 2. If needed, grind the sample to achieve a smoother surface using a fine-grit sandpaper. 3. Optionally, seal the material with a protective coating to prevent oxidation and degradation. 4. Allow the coating to cure for at least 24 hours before handling.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Remove the alloyed material from the crucible. 2. If needed, grind the sample to achieve a smoother surface using a fine-grit sandpaper. 3. Optionally, seal the material with a protective coating to prevent oxidation and degradation. 4. Allow the coating to cure for at least 24 hours before handling.
